result.execSummary:
The defendant James Myron Leonard was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
03:32 PM Defendant James Myron Leonard in court with attorney Melissa M. Petersen.  Defendant James Myron Leonard in custody.  Kaley Walker appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Includes 19F28.  Plea on 19CF28 -   Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def.    Constitutional rights explained to defendant  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights.    DEF PLEADS GUILTY to Count 1.    Facts are correct  COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS  The court finds the defendant guilty and adjudicates defendant guilty of Ct. 1 in 19CF28.  Counts 2 and 3 are dismissed.  Walker addresses the court regarding sentencing.  Petersen addresses the court regarding sentencing. 

Court orders:

16CF39 - 3 years and 6 months in the Wisconsin State Prison System, 18 months initial confinement,  24 months Extended Supervision, No consumption or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs, Any progamming as recommended by agent, 249 days credit.  

19CF28 -  One year and one day in Wisconsin State Prison System,  concurrent with 16CF39.   64 days credit.  Costs in the amount of $515.  Time to pay - through extended supervision.

Appeal rights are given.
4:01 p.m.
Melissa Petersen
Probation review hearing on March 5, 2019 at 03:15 pm.
